name: danger_asteroids
title: ASTEROID FIELD DETECTED
content: Our short-range sensors have picked up an asteroid field nearby. Might be some useful minerals in there.

win.response: You send a scout ship with utility lasers to carve out some ore. Once they're done you process it into fuel!

fail.response: You send a scout ship to carve out some ore. A micrometeorite swipes it out of existence, taking the crew with it.

options.response: You leave the asteroids where they are. Can't risk damage to the ship.

name: danger_micrometeorites
title: MICROMETEORITE BARRAGE
content: You can make out a sound like hail falling on a metal roof. Navigation Officer [NAME_NAVIGATOR] says you've jumped right into a debris field.

win.response: [NAME_PILOT] threads the needle, pulling you out of the path of the bigger fragments. You take a few hits, but the ship survives.

fail.response: [NAME_PILOT] opens the throttle and tries to power through the field. A metal shard looms out of the darkness. [NAME_PILOT] is fast, but not fast enough. You pull through. Barely.

options.response: Chief Engineer [NAME_ENGINEER] diverts power to the emergency shield. It screeches into life and drains the fuel cells. The storm continues, but the hull holds.

name: danger_storm
title: ION STORM
content: A panel lights up on the bridge. Moments later a warning comes through from belowdecks - you've jumped right into a cloud of ionised gas.

win.response: [NAME_PILOT] hits the afterburner and the ship lurches out of danger. Close one.

fail.response: [NAME_PILOT] floors it, but the cloud is huge. The shield soaks up most of the damage, but ion interference causes it to score the hull badly.

win.response: [NAME_ENGINEER] flips the shield to static mode and [NAME_PILOT] kills the engines. You ride it out with minimal damage.

fail.response: [NAME_ENGINEER] locks down all systems, but after hours of bombardment the heating system overloads and causes an explosion in the mess hall. [NAME_ENGINEER] barely manages to contain the damage.

name: danger_miningDrones
title: INCOMING DRONES
content: You drop into a system full of old mining drones, leftover from colonial days. The further you go, the more of them blink into life and turn to watch your progress.

win.response: [NAME_PILOT] diverts all power to engines. The hull scrapes and screeches as drones bounce away, unable to get a purchase. After ten minutes you get out of range and the sound suddenly dies away.

fail.response: [NAME_PILOT] tries, but one drone clamps onto the top deck and starts drilling into the hull. [NAME_ENGINEER] manages to cycle the power and demagnetise it. It detaches and floats away, helpless.

win.response: [NAME_PILOT] nods and holds the ship on a steady course. Everyone on the bridge is jumpy, but the drones just watch you go by. It's quiet.

fail.response: There's a screech as one drone scores a gouge in the hull, then another, and another. [NAME_PILOT] panics, but [NAME_ENGINEER] quickly overloads the shield, knocking the drones out of commission.
